result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron Henry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during ES, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All Non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.

superMiscConds.notes:
- NO CONTACT with victim T.T. or N.M.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: - No Contact with firearms. Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession. Court advised due to felony conviction and the defendant is prohibited from possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 2 as Amended:  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 2 years, consecutive to 16CF1161, credit for 350 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 year, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 year. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- Batterers Intervention program.
- Parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No contact with victim T.T. or N.M.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  

As to Count 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Use of a Dangerous Weapon enhancer DISMISSED.

Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 2 as Amended:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

As to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Counts1, 3-8 DISMISSED but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant wishes to proceed with sentencing.  Court passes case to allow defendant time to think about whether or not to proceed with sentencing.

Statements by T.T. and N.M.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  Statements by state that witnesses are in court and requests tha the warrants are withdrawn. Court orders warrants withdrawn.  

State filed an Amended Information for 16CF1161.  Offer placed on the record.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Case passed to allow defense time to fill out plea forms.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Jury back in the box at 1:40.

Jury list received and filed.  

Jury out of the box at 3:15.

Discussion regarding witness testimony placed on the record.

Jury back in the box at 3:40.

At the hour of 3:42 jury was excused for the evening and ordered to return on 8/2/2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Both parties are ready to proceed. Case passed. Case recalled. Discussion regarding Notice of Alibi placed on the record.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:17.

At the hour of 11:46 jury excused for lunch and ordered to return at the hour of 1:30.

Jury out of box at 11:46.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Final Pretrial held. Case remains in trial posture. State placed final offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State withdrew their offer to the defendant. Case set for Jury Trial on 08/01/2016 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to Branch 24.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Return on Doctor's Report. Parties not contesting report. Court adopts findings of the report, found defendant competent to proceed, and reinstates court proceedings. Cash bail of $15,000.00 reinstated. All other conditions of bail remain. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Scheduling Order signed and filed. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Discussion of competency placed on the record. State objects. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found good cause to waive speedy trial demand and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. In chambers discussions placed on the record. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court ordered proceedings suspended.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Jason Canfield.  Defendant Laron Henry in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. State ready to proceed to trial. Defense raised competency. This court contacted Forensic Unit to attempt emergency competency evaluation. Due to Doctor unavailability, court ordered case passed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Laron Henry in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Defense motion, Court ordered COUNTS 2-3 DISMISSED.   AS TO COUNTS 1, 4-5: Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defendant enters a plea of not guilty to counts 6-8. DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.    Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-29-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
